description: Smallest prime a(n) such that the sum of n consecutive primes starting with a(n) is divisible by n.
comments: See A132809 for another version.In some cases (n=1,2,25,..), like a(25)=97, the sum of 25 consecutive primes starts with the 25th prime and is divided by 25: Sum=97+...+227=3925=25*157
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: Min[q_1; Sum[q_i; {i, 1, n}]]=n*X], q_i is a prime (rarely only q_i=Prime[i])
example: a(8) = 17 since the sum of the 8 consecutive primes starting with 17 is 17 + 19 + 23 + 29 + 31 + 37 + 41 + 43 = 240, which is divisible by 8.  No prime less than 17 has this property: for example, 7 + 11 + ... + 31 = 150 which is not divisible by 8.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = 1, t}, While[t = Table[Prime[i], {i, k, k + n - 1}]; Mod[Plus @@ t, n] > 0, k++ ]; t]; First /@ Table[f[n], {n, 67}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Oct 09 2006 *)
